page.title: 17Newbiggin Farm,Filey.
page.content: My father gets up at about 6a.m. to milk the cows.This is finished by 8.30a.m. and then he has breakfast and takes us to school.The milking equipment has to be cleaned and the cows put out into the field.At 11a.m. he has a ten minute break and then at this time of the year he starts haymaking.This will take up most of the afternoon until the cows have to be brought in at 4p.m.When this is finished and the equipment cleaned again ready for the morning.Tea is about 7p.m.and then out into the fields again until 10p.m.He likes to be in bed by 11p.m.If he is not too busy after tea we go out on the horse and cart.Our farm was built in the 17th century and there are 114 dairy cows,2 saddle-back pigs and a welshcob horse.
